I built an optimized scroll container that can scroll over hundreds of items while maintaining our target framerate.
The shop UI was built to ensure it could easily scale as more shop items were designed and added.
I handled both the backend and frontend for systems such as Unit, Equipment, and Skill progression.
Using a custom Behavior Tree system, enemies could be given custom AI with very little hastle.

gallery.desc: Unity Nav-Meshes were used to let multiple enemies path around the screen.
Multiple layers of nav-meshes were used to allow enemies to move over/under each other. The Nav-Mesh was also updated to only ever include open rooms.

gallery.desc: The puzzle controller took in an action, such as swapping two pieces or replacing a piece, asynchronously updated the board, and then returned a list of snapshots that a Monobehavior would lerp through.
An idepended class would analysize the board, looking for possible moves. This algorithm only looked at pieces dirtied by the previous action, reducing the needed calculations.
